title: Illegal instruction when building rust 1.3 on Debian 8 Jessie 64bits and using system-wide LLVM 3.5
body:
When building rust 1.3 on debian Jessie 64-bit **with the LLVM software provided by the distribution**, compilation fails with an illegal instruction error. When rust is built with the bundled LLVM, no error occurs.
Rust Build has been configured with : `./configure --prefix=/opt/rust/gcc-localllvm --llvm-root=/usr/lib/llvm-3.5`. Debian Jessie comes with llvm-3.5, no higher version is available from official repositories.

The last lines of the log are : 

``` shell
rustc: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage1/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/librustc_typeck
rustc: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage1/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/librustc_resolve
rustc: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage1/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/librustc_trans
Illegal instruction
/home/user/rust/gcc-locallvm/rustc-1.3.0/mk/target.mk:171: recipe for target 'x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage1/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/stamp.rustc_trans' failed
make: *** [x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage1/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/stamp.rustc_trans] Error 132
```

Running `make --trace` gave the faulty command line : 

``` shell
CFG_LLVM_LINKAGE_FILE=/home/user/rust/gcc-locallvm/rustc-1.3.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/rt/llvmdeps.rs LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/home/user/rust/gcc-locallvm/rustc-1.3.0/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage1/lib:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH   x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage1/bin/rustc --cfg stage1  -O --cfg rtopt -C prefer-dynamic --target=x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu  -D warnings -L "x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/rt" -L "/usr/lib/llvm-3.5/lib"    --out-dir x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage1/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib -C extra-filename=-7e44814b src/librustc_trans/lib.rs
```

Running the same command without the "-O" flags works.
Running the same command with -C opt-level=0 works.
Running the same command with -C opt-level=1 fails.
